summary: An Ordinance annulling and repealing Ordinance No. 12917, entitled "An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Dearborn Street, from Rainier Avenue to Seventeenth Avenue South; and Seventeenth Avenue South, from Dearborn Street to the alley West of Twentieth Avenue South, by the construction of concrete sidewalks with necessary crosswalks, in accordance with Resolution No. 671 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington, entitled "An act authorizing issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency," approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899; and authorizing and directing the Board of Public Works to cancel and contract let in pursuance of said Ordinance; and authorizing the City Comptroller to withdraw the assessment roll, heretofore filed in conformity with said ordinance.
